snippet: Detectives who searched the home of Pedro Hernandez, who confessed to killing Etan Patz, said they found a toy and garments but that they might have belonged to previous residents.
abstract: Detectives who searched the Maple Shade, NJ, home of Pedro Hernandez, who confessed to killing Etan Patz in 1979, say they have found clothing and an old toy that may serve as evidence in the case.

byline.original: By WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM and JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN

lead_paragraph: Detectives who searched the home of Pedro Hernandez, who confessed to killing Etan Patz, said they found a toy and garments but that they might have belonged to previous residents.

headline.seo: Boys’ Clothes Found in Search of Home of Patz Case Suspect
headline.main: Boys’ Clothes May Be Clue in Patz Case
headline.print_headline: Boys’ Clothes May Be Clue In Patz Case
